description:
Includes 52 cards with all original Sriracha and food themed illustrations.

Divvy up the cards evenly between players and get ready to slap the deck for pairs and sandwiches. Or play Sriracha Cards to stay alive! The first player to collect all the cards wins.

Pair Them Up
If the card played is a match to the top card, this is a pair. First one to slap the pile gets all the cards. Add these new cards to the bottom of your deck.

Mmmmm...sandwiches
If the card played is a match to the card underneath the top card, this is a sandwich. First one to slap the pile gets all the cards.

Add Some Heat
Play Sriracha Cards to get more cards and stay alive!

—description from the publisher

Welcome to Valroc, the famous city of wizards. You are one of them competing in a great tournament to acquire the Archmage title. With the help of your assistant, earn skill points in each of the 4 elements (Fire, Water, Earth and Air) and enter the arena to tame and chase the most dangerous creatures from the land. Will you take risks in fighting mythical creatures, use black magic or rely on your own knowledge to achieve this actions? Train yourself, attend magical lessons and make offerings to the gods… As many possible strategies as imaginable but only yours will lead you to victory!

In Valroc, you play wizards in competition to acquire the Archmage title. For that, you will have to defeat terrible creatures (or tame them). The first player who has defeated or tamed six creatures ends the game. The winner is the player with the most Prestige Points.

The game is split into two different phases :
•    The first one is a draft phase in which the players must select the creatures they will have to fight. Thereby they will prepare their tournament as well as possible.
•    The second phase is the tournament in which the players will fight against each other by a worker placement mechanism.

Welcome to the world of Elementa Arcanum.  Hundreds of years in the future, scientific advances have given humans control over the power behind the elemental forces of nature: Fire, Water, Wind and Earth.  Through genetic engineering, the richest families of the galaxy have evolved a race of superhuman wizards.  The strongest representatives of each generation participate in a galactic tournament once a year called the Elementa Arcanum -- a spectacle so mesmerizing it surpassed the Olympics and rendered it obsolete.  As the years pass, the most talented of each generation slowly begin to emerge until a victor is declared.  The winner is named the Elementa Prima and dons the Black Hole Robes, forever etched into history.  Will you wield Ultima and master the 4 Elements?

Elementa Arcanum is a deck-building card game for 1-6+ players.  Players alternate between Combat Turns, where they vie for Stars (Victory Points) and Research Turns where players can improve and optimize their decks.  The first player to 5 Stars wins the game.  The rules are relatively simple and can be taught to newcomers while the game is underway through the "Teaching Game" system.  The game has a very small form-factor and is highly portable.  A common shop containing new cards for players to acquire uses a tiered system and uses rules to prevent shop stagnation.

A version of the game Bild-A-Word made for preschoolers and kindergarteners.  Whereas the original game has letters on the cards, this one also has numbers, colors, and pictures.

From an advert for it: 
"Make the Bobbys, The Bettys and the Johnnys of pre-school or Kindergarten age happy -- by giving them

BILD-A-WORD
for TOTS
"A Kindergarten Education in Itself"

Start them right with games that teach as they amuse. BILD-A-WORD for TOTS is based on the methods employed in the schools today. It is a game and a toy that teaches little minds colors, numerals, picture construction and spelling."

'During the first two months of 1917 Russia was still a Romanov monarchy. Eight months later the Bolsheviks stood at the helm. They were little known to anybody when the year began, and their leaders were still under indictment for state treason when they came to power. You will not find another such sharp turn in history especially if you remember that it involves a nation of 150 million people...' 
             Leon Trotsky, History of the Russian Revolutions

The Russian Revolutions: 1914-21 is a social-political conflict game for 2 to 5 players. In the game, players take on the role of one of five factions (Monarchists, Octobrists, Cadets (Constitutional Democrats), Left Reformists, or the Revolutionary Left) active in the events of the Russian Revolutions of 1917. Some factions begin the game as Governing factions with state power; others as the opposition. Whatever your factions, you will need to build your political influence, maintain your military power, manage alliances with other factions, and protect Russia from foreign invaders. The winner of the game is the faction that gains state power, and uses that effectively to change Russian society as its ideology dictates.

The game is played on two boards, one depicting the European part of Russia, the other representing St. Petersburg/ Petrograd (Russia's capital city and the 'cradle of the revolution'). Political influence is represented by coloured blocks; a vast range of historical leaders as well as military units (with historical designations) are represented by colourful double-sided chits.

The game uses an innovative system in which player either spend 'action points' to take actions or to buy cards, and thereby gain influence among various significant institutions, organisations, and social groups which can be used in later turns. Historical events are affect play as they are drawn from time-tiered event decks. New cards are added to these decks as certain conditions are met in game play.

Unlike most political games, the Russian Revolutions: 1914-21 is  very suitable for solitaire play. There is little hidden information and, while alliances between factions is an important part of play, these alliances are formed and broken automatically as the ideological position of you faction changes through the game. That means there is no need for long breaks in play where players 'negotiate' and scheme - all your scheming will happen on the board.

Can you impress the lady enough to win her hand in marriage? Will you be the perfect choice, or will you take all her love and give nothing back? And on your turn to be the lady, will you find true love, or heart break?

Lady's Choice is a light bluffing game about the ugly side of romance.

Each card has a dandiness value. Some cards stop other cards from scoring. The cards that DO score (positive or negative) are totalled for a dandiness value of the gentleman. This is used to calculate the dandiness ranking. (Most Dandy, Second most, and so on.)

The married gentleman gains points according to his rank. 1st? 1 point. 2nd? 2 points, and so on. Also an extra point if he's the worst. The lady gains points according to the reverse of her husband's rank. Worst? No points. Second worst? 1 point. Third worst? 2 points, and so on. Also an extra point if he's the best.

Everyone gets to be the lady once and marry once. Once all players have been the lady, the game ends.

Most points at the end wins.

At Wake Island an outnumbered Marine Defense Battalion showed the world what they were made of when they fought off a Japanese landing force and secured America’s first but very fleeting victory in World War II.

The Japanese flush with victory after ravaging Pearl Harbor turned their sights to the small strategic island but failed to account for the courage and tenacity of the defenders. Instead of an easy victory, the Japanese were handed their first defeat when two of the attacking destroyers were sunk with all hands lost. The surprising victory immortalized this small coral atoll as the Alamo of the Pacific.

In this solitaire game, you as the American player must hold  out for as long as possible against the overwhelming Japanese force arrayed against you. Victory Points are gained by the number of Invasion Attempt Counters revealed and enemy ships placed Out of Action.  While it is unlikely you will be able to defeat the invasion force in full, you might be able to change the outcome of the Pacific War by making the invasion of Wake Island a very costly and tragic victory for the Japanese.

The Escape game for London fans.

In this gritty escape thriller, players must crack tricky puzzles and encrypted codes to escape from the English metropolis. The gripping escape story takes them to London's most popular landmarks such as Big Ben, London Eye and many more.

--publisher's description

This fun party game is the perfect alternative to rich chocolate gifts. Instead of sugar-sweet calorie bombs, the recipient gets an exciting game of tile-laying in which the aim is to create the most exquisite bouquets of chocolates and give them to his or her fellow players. But watch out: To become a true Maître Chocolatier and win at this game, you need a watchful eye, a gift for combination and a clever mind. This is the only way to create the most gifts of chocolates and emerge as the winner.

The winner here is the player who was able to give away the most boxes of chocolates to his fellow players at the end. To assemble the perfect selection, you must follow the instructions on your order cards. But beware: you need imagination, a good eye and a lot of dexterity to create the perfect chocolate variation.
    
At the beginning, each player receives order cards on which certain praline arrangements are depicted. The players now have to reconstruct these on the moving playing field, following 4 swapping rules. Once you have completed an order, the order card is gift-wrapped and you may give it to one of your fellow players.
    
When one of you has given away his last order card, the game is over. However, the player who finishes first does not automatically win. It is much more decisive to whom he has given his praline creations - and whether he has also received plenty of gifts from the others. So it remains exciting for everyone until the points are counted.

The players start at the starting spaces, representing a hiking club corresponding of their choice with a capital of 100 points. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. Often points are awarded or deducted. On the roll of a 3 or 6 the player gets to chose to move his piece or draw an event card. At the roll of a 1 the player gets another turn.

After an agreed on amount of time the game ends and the player with the most points is the winner.

The address of the publisher has a pre 1992 zip code and the game map shows only West Germany it places the game before 1990.
The use of a tube instead of a box indicates that the game was most likely published in the 1980's or late 70's.

—user summary

A little game of bluff. Players use cards of different value and category (forward,back) to progress on the pitch.

The game is divided in 2 halves. A half ends when a player can't draw cards.

Each half is divided in rounds. For each round, the 2 players draw and discard cards to maintain a hand of 4 cards. the comparison of the value and type of cards gives the result : attacker progression on the pitch or ball winned by defender

The winner is the player with the higher score at the end of the match.

Super-Chance is a dice racing game with a background in traffic education. Players roll the dice and drag their pieces along a winding path to the finish line. Those who are lucky may use shortcuts. Along the way, the meaning of traffic signs is explained. The player who gets his 3 figures to the finish line first wins the game.

—user summary

In Star Trek: Missions, you explore all the mystery and excitement of the galaxy, featuring characters, locations, and equipment in familiar groups or in strange new combinations. Assemble a crew with anyone from Commander Riker to DaiMon Bok, grab a Bat'leth, and take on challenges like organizing a Diplomatic Conference, or getting trapped in the Holodeck!

The combinations in each hand create a brand new episode of the Enterprise's continuing mission. Make the best combo to score the highest points and claim victory.

—description from the publisher

Chronicles of Avel is a cooperative board game for the whole family. Take the role of brave heroes and heroines with a mission to save your magical land.

Create your character and give them a unique name. Get your equipment, upgrade it and prepare for battle. But remember to wisely choose what you carry as your backpack has limited space. Armed and ready, explore the land in search of adventure and fortune.

Answer the Queen’s call and fight together against the servants of the Black Moon. Defend the castle, banish the Beast, and save Avel!

In Chronicles of Avel players will be exploring the world of Avel, moving on a modular board created from hexagonal tiles (different every time). On their journey they will encounter dangerous monsters to fight and roll dice to determine success. Each victory leads to a prize - new weapon, armor, potions and gold - which will make heroes more powerful and unstoppable. But to earn equipment players will have to search through magical bag and choose using only their sense of touch. Victory awaits for those who will cooperate, prepare themselves and defeat the Beast and all his servants.

YEAR 30175: For thousands of years, the destruction of natural ecosystems and pollution have turned the planet into a desolate and practically uninhabitable place.  While the less fortunate species have become extinct, others have adapted and evolved in union with the Orchard, the last green lung, our home.  The RabbitZ!, a fearful horde of mutant zombie rabbits, come out of their burrow with only one goal... EAT! The Orchard and the vegetable people are in danger... But this time we are ready!

Using the technology of the Ancients, we have created great machines that are powered by the energy of the Orchard. Piloted by the brave Guardians of the Orchard, these powerful robots are our last hope.

Rabbitz & Robots is a tower defense card game for 1 to 5 players in which players will become the Guardians of the Orchard, a group of brave vegetables who pilot combat robots and defend the Orchard from the invasion of the RabbitZ.

Starting with the player who has the highest value RabbitZ in their path, the game will be played in turns and clockwise. Each player’s turn is divided into two phases:

In phase 1: Take the top card of the Burrow deck and place it at the start of your path (next to the Burrow deck) with the RabbitZ side up. If there are already other RabbitZ on your path, they will move in the direction of your Robot to make room for the new RabbitZ. The paths have a maximum of three spaces, this means that if there are already three RabbitZ in a path and a fourth one enters, it will push the others and the closest RabbitZ to the Robot will sneak into the player’s Garden, counting as a negative score at the end of the game.

In phase 2: Choose an action between: Super Attack, Charge Robot, Use weapons or Pass turn.

The game ends when the Burrow deck ends and there are no RabbitZs left in front of the players.

The player with the fewest negative points (RabbitZ value) in his Orchard wins.


AÑO 30175
Desde hace miles de años, la destrucción de ecosistemas naturales y la contaminación han convertido el planeta en un lugar desolado y prácticamente inhabitable.

Mientras que las especies menos afortunadas se han extinguido, otras nos adaptamos y evolucionamos en unión con la Huerta, el último pulmón verde, nuestro hogar.

Aquí, hortalizas de todos los colores convivimos y trabajamos unidas para proteger la tierra que nos da la vida. Pero se acerca la primavera y, como cada año, el miedo se apodera de la Huerta...

¡Los RabbitZ!, una temible horda de conejos zombis mutantes, salen de su madriguera con un único objetivo... ¡COMER!
La Huerta y el pueblo hortaliza están en peligro… ¡Pero esta vez estamos preparadas!

Utilizando la tecnología de los Antiguos hemos creado grandes máquinas que funcionan gracias a la energía de la Huerta, la fuerza mística de la naturaleza que fluye a través de la tierra y de cada hortaliza. Pilotados por los valientes Guardianes de la Huerta, estos poderosos robots son nuestra última esperanza.
                                        -Anciano Coliflor

Rabbitz & Robots es un juego de cartas "tower defense" de 1 a 5 jugadores a partir de 10 años y con una duración aproximada de 20 minutos, en el que los jugadores se convertirán en los Guardianes de la Huerta, un grupo de valientes hortalizas que pilotan robots de combate y defienden la Huerta de la invasión de los RabbitZ.

Shortly after Poland was conquered in 1939, Hitler begin urging an immediate attack in the West. The original plans were uninspiring and his generals feared an attritional stalemate. Over the winter the Germans keep taking the measure of their opponents and hit upon a plan was that inspired, risky, and utterly decisive. Ironic of Hitler to assume his remarkable success was simply the new template for all future campaigns. His eyes turned east....

But, why, exactly did France fall? Against the Odds' 2015 annual features four top designers all tasked with re-examining the 1940 campaign and answering that very question. They’ve each settled on a single overriding theme to focus on.

Springtime for Hitler explores the angle that the Germans at this time were quite simply indeed "supermen" at the top of their game. Possessing the best tactical air force, the best plans and doctrine, and well motivated by National-Socialist ideology, they were unstoppable. Or were they?

Shortly after Poland was conquered in 1939, Hitler begin urging an immediate attack in the West. The original plans were uninspiring and his generals feared an attritional stalemate. Over the winter the Germans keep taking the measure of their opponents and hit upon a plan was that inspired, risky, and utterly decisive. Ironic of Hitler to assume his remarkable success was simply the new template for all future campaigns. His eyes turned east.

But why, exactly, did France fall? Against the Odds 2017 Annual  features four top designers all tasked with re-examining the 1940 campaign and answering that very question.

The Seeds of Disaster is a game about how events of the 1930s affected World War II, most especially the German invasion 
of the West in 1940. This game connects a war campaign with  the military preparations, intelligence developments, and  diplomacy that preceded it. It is an attempt to represent a  piece of history as interconnected with other historical developments. This is a two-player game in which one player takes the Germans and the other the Western Allies, including 
France, Great Britain, Belgium, and Holland. Victory is determined by control of Mobilization Center and Objective Areas at the end of the last turn of play.

In broad outline, what you see here is a game that is multi-dimensional and coupled. The initial phase of play creates a game history of the 1930s to generate the concrete situation for the German invasion of the West in 1940. By intertwining fresh dimensions of Intelligence and Command, the game creates new ways in which the 1940 situation can be distinctive from 
one play of the game to the next. The invasion campaign is the culmination of the game. With this partially scripted history, 
how does the war progress? The geography will be the same, the deployment of the forces may be similar, but the details of 
the forces and their Intelligence and Command postures can be very different.

Data Leak is a game of making words and breaking passwords. Acting as a skilled computer hacker, you will attempt to break your opponents’ passwords before they can break yours, knowing that these passwords must be formed from a pool of only 45 letters. 
Unfortunately, data leaks happen every turn and you’ll have to be canny about which letters of your password you reveal to your opponents. 
By browsing the darknet and using threats such as viruses, worms and trojan horses, more letters will be revealed until you eventually break your opponents’ passwords. 
The last player with an unguessed password will win the game.

—description from the designer

It's the end of the world, as an asteroid is barreling toward Earth, with the very real possibility of making the planet go Kaput. Lucky for you, you're a wealthy elite with your own underground bunker within which to ride out the apocalypse. However, what you never counted on were all the "normies," showing up, at the last moment, wanting you to save them. You can't take them all in, and if your fellow elites form alliances with the best prospects, you won't retain power inside the bunker for long. So, choose wisely, my friend.

The City of Shadows board game is a co-creation of the Les Baroudeurs brand and Agent Paper.

Discover a strategic board game full of twists and turns playable in 2 teams of 2, 4, or 6 players. Your goal is simple: take control of Rennes (the city, not those of Santa Claus).

For this, several means are available to you:
- Capture all the properties of the game board
- Kill all the characters of the opposing team
- Arrest the entire opposing clan by the police
- Discreetly poison the drinks of opposing players (this victory mode can only work once against the same players)

Explore the city of Rennes and its iconic late 18th-century locations while using strategy, cunning, and composure to win the game.


Le jeu de plateau Cité des Ombres est une co-création de la marque Les Baroudeurs et d’Agent Paper.
Découvrez un jeu de plateau stratégique plein de rebondissements jouable en 2 équipes de 2, 4, ou 6 joueurs. Votre but est simple : prenez le contrôle de Rennes (la ville, pas ceux du Père Noël). Pour cela, plusieurs moyens sont mis à votre disposition :
– Capturez toutes les propriétés du plateau de jeu
– Tuez tous les personnages de l’équipe adverse
– Faites arrêtez par la police tout le clan adverse
– Empoisonnez discrètement les boissons des joueurs adverses (ce mode de victoire ne peut fonctionner qu’une fois contre les mêmes joueurs)Explorez la ville de Rennes et ses lieux emblématiques de la fin du XVIIIe siècle tout en faisant preuve de stratégie, de ruse et de sang froid afin de gagner la partie.

Sunbed Rush is a strategic card game.

While reserving sunbeds in real life is not very kind to your fellow guests at a resort, it is absolutely mandatory in Sunbed Rush! Place your towels to reserve your sunbed. Secure your sunbed with an object to make it look like you really are in the neighborhood. Or place a guest on your sunbed; a guest who will help you with his or her quirks. Make sure to secure the best and the most sunbeds to earn points and win the game!

The game is played in 8 rounds. Each round players receive 1 new card from the draw pile after which they all choose 2 cards to play in that game round.
A player can select 2 cards in any combination of:
- towel cards (to reserve a spot at any pool)
- object cards (towels with an object on it cannot be removed)
- guest cards (placed on your towel to help you)
- activity cards (to clear the entire pool of the guests indicated on the activity card)

After 8 rounds, players no longer have cards in their hands and the game ends.

The player with the most points wins, points are counted at the end of the game where you earn points for:
1. Having the most towels at a pool: Each pool card indicates the number of points players can earn for having the most towels at that pool
2. Empty/unoccupied towel: each unoccupied towel (a towel without a guest or object) earns 1 additional point

—description from the publisher

Alexander the Great is the second "historical" title of the One Page Games series.
It’s a quick game where you play the role of Alexander on his march from Macedonia to India, where he will meet the Indian army at the Hydaspes river (326BC).

The game uses the engine of Hannibal ad Portas with several changes introduced to better represent the campaigns of Alexander:

     Companions special rules
     Persian and Indian armies
     Army Morale


New stratagems and events have been added to provide new challenges to the player.

–description from the publisher

Theme: Your suit of 13 normal playing cards is an elite company of warriors with different combat strengths and movement rates.

Objective/Game Play: From a random layout on a board space, your cards move and attack the enemy warriors, taking as many as you can as you try to capture their king or stronghold. You can stack your cards to increase their combat score.

In Battle Ace, face-down spare cards form a playing "board" area and the two armies (hearts and spades) are shuffled then placed in two face-up rows at either end of this "board". A card or stack is then moved by the player on alternate turns.

Players choose just one action on their turn: Move, Stack. Attack, Pack

The game ends when either a king is killed/taken or a king reaches the opponent's back row. Bonus points are awarded for either of these.

The players add up the melee abilities (face-values of number cards, King/Queen/Jack = 10) plus any bonus points from achieving a win condition. Highest total wins.

Variations: There are optional rules for jokers, adding dice, campaigns and much more.

Welcome to a world invisible to the naked eye, where cells evolve and compete to grow into the biggest, strongest, and fastest living organisms.

You will start off small and slow and weak. Collect enough genes to begin laying down cells, then choose which adaptations to focus on and which organisms will give you the best edge.

As you grow, you will need to make sacrifices to get to the next level, but everything ramps up as you race to the end, claiming the most organisms to win.

During their turn a player plays cards from their hand to their tableau and finishes by drawing. The game ends when any player claims three organisms (two for a 4-player game), which is also the win condition.

There is also a solitaire and co-op version with similar game play.

Deck building card game. Solo to unlimited player. Lovecraft-like themed. Standard game allows for around 4+ players. Add another artifact pack to allow additional 4+ more players. Game can be played with players having their own packs. Players can join any active game at the start of any round. No need to wait for end of game to join.

This is a 2 pack game, both packs are needed for the full game.
Book of Artifacts
Book of incantations

Casting "Bewitched" Incantation cards will affect everyone including the caster. There are "Aura" Incantation cards that help protect from "Bewitched" cards.

Tournament style also available, in the rules.

HEKKspedisjon - Ekspedisjon Europa is a competition driven, mid level strategy game.

You play as one of six characters, traveling around Europe. Each character has his own strengths and weaknesses. You will encounter people that may help or hinder you along the way and you will rely on getting your hands on the best expedition-gear to stay in front. Both regular shops and the black market is available to you as long as you have cash in hand. Both competitions and individual expedition-goals will drive you towards your goal, but don't underestimate the power of gaining knowledge of places and people you encounter.

Each turn consists of 4 phases.
First phase is "Adjusting hunger". The player adjusts their hunger bar according to their placement on the board.
Second phase is "Shopping phase". Players may do repairs on their vehicle (if applicable) or buy food. Players may also buy items from the black market (if in a city) or from the shop.
Third phase is "Action / work". The player chooses whether they will do a job to earn money or draw a city event/travel event card.
Fourth phase is "Movement / work" The player chooses whether they do a job to earn money or if they want to move towards their next expedition goal.

The game ends when the first person enters the "End" position on "The winning track".
To win you need to collect expedition points and/or knowledge points. The first player to gain enough points to enter the "End" position of "The winning track" is the winner of the game.

The year is 1660. The pirate ship crews are determined to find out who is the best captain amongst the pirates.

Glory Islands features easy-to-learn rules and fast, simple turns! You must outwit your opponents to claim fame and fortune. It has two different game boards and also includes a mini-expansion in the main game box.

Glory Islands is played over a series of rounds in which players simultaneously play sailing cards from their hands. The card values define the turn order, how far ships can move on the board, and where a player’s pirates may be placed on the board. Depending on where they are placed, pirates may receive glory, treasure tokens, or barrels. The cards may also provide bonus actions that players can use to gain an advantage over their opponents. When pirates occupy all of the spaces on an island, the player with the most pirates on that island will gain the most glory.

The game is over when one or more pirate ships have completed the route around the islands. The player with the most glory is crowned the "King of the Pirates"!

The magical universe of Harry Potter meets the frantic and hilarious one of Time's up!

With Time’s Up!, you have 30 seconds and 3 rounds to guess the most words!

In the first round, you describe the cards without saying what is written there; in the second, make the same cards guess with a single word; in the third, mimic them to your teammates!

The late Viscount Pennington of Meyersbury has hidden his invaluable treasure in the gardens of his sprawling mansion. Many treasure hunters have tried to find it and have failed. That doesn’t mean all is lost! You’re a trainer of some crafty puggles - cute, cuddly, treasure-sniffing critters with a nose for all things bling. Can you guide them to the hidden treasure? Let’s dig to win BIG!

Crafty Puggles is a tile placement and path building game that will transform your family game nights! Kids will learn and master basic fractions, pattern recognition, strategy, planning and creativity to guide their puggles to the ultimate treasure! It isn’t always a walk in the park because there are tons of twists and turns. It’s fun and different every time you play!

In Crafty Puggles, you are treasure hunters guiding your trained puggles to dig their way to the hidden treasure. Your goal is to lay path tiles in your garden grove and help your puggle reach the treasure. You must also pay attention to what opponents are doing and strategically prevent them from finishing their paths.

The game board is divided into four garden groves, one for each player. Each garden grove consists of 20 squares in 4 rows and 5 columns. The treasure is located in the central treasure square. You create a path on the board by placing path tiles on the squares in your garden grove and connecting the muddy parts only. A path can also be blocked by the hound.

Every player starts with 1 puggle den and 1 puggle pawn of their choice. Place your puggle pawn at the start square of your puggle den mat. You keep path tiles you collect during the game in the Banked Tiles area. you can bank a maximum of 3 tiles. Dice roles will help you place your tiles, rotate your tiles, move your puggle and activate powers.

The first player to create an unblocked path from the start square to the central treasure square wins the game!

Spend the afternoon in your rooftop or backyard garden. Relax while enjoying this artful game of picking, pairing, and planting fruits and vegetables. Grow your plants in whatever container you can. Wheelbarrows, boots, suitcases – use anything you can to grow delicious eats! Will you create the most delicious garden?

Over the course of a game of Delicious, players fill their respective gardens with fruits and vegetables by sketching them based on cards and tokens that are revealed in the community area. Players take their turns sketching simultaneously each round as these plants are revealed. Earn the most points by planting fruits and vegetables in your makeshift containers and planters.

A game lasts 12 rounds. Every round, 2 Vegetable cards are flipped (1 from each deck) and a Fruit / Tool token is placed on each card. Each player then decides to use one or both cards (and their tokens), given certain restrictions. When you use a card and token, you mark your Garden and Play sheets, trying to get different combinations of fruits and vegetables.

The cards in the middle are common, but players place them in different containers within their garden setting up different combinations and scoring opportunities. Bonus tools and special powers mean that no two gardens are ever alike.

After 12 rounds, the player with the highest score wins. 
- If there is a tie, the player whose fruit planter score is higher wins.
- If there is still a tie, the player who has marked the most First Potter Bonus icons wins.

OMNIA is a collectible deckbuilding game in which each player contributes a portion of the cards used for each game. 
When the game starts, each player has a ‘’Player Deck” identical to each other player. As the game progresses, players use Source cards to purchase other cards from the Shop Zone and add them to their Player Decks. Players then use these cards to battle with other players, and fight to build the deck with the highest Prestige!

Players can collect cards, and build ‘’Flavor Decks’’ of their own to change the pool of cards that can appear in the Shop Zone over the course of a game. In this way players can not only increase the chances of a card appearing, but also gives players a chance to try out each other’s cards, to discover new strategies, and to find new cards to include in their own Flavor Deck in future games.

New cards are released regularly in booster packs, as well as pre-constructed, single player theme decks that give new players a quick, and easy way to get started!

OMNIA Collectible Deckbuilding Game is for 2 or more players ages 14 and up, but is best played with 4 players

On the modern battlefield, military units face off against each other, the terrain, and the elements. Carve out the best strategy to navigate the terrain and build structures to control land. But be on your guard! Pitfalls await you around every turn, and your entire strategy can quickly unravel…

Ground Assault® is a military-themed game where two to four players navigate challenging terrain, build structures to take control of land, and battle to defend their land.

The object of the game is to control six pieces of land at the same time across the battlefield before your opponents do the same. Each time you play, the tiles forming the battlefield are randomized, making each game a unique challenge!

A turn starts with 10 actions points that can be used in various ways. The most common ways to use the AP are moving troops around the board and using a combination of AP and skill cards to build something on a terrain tile which represents a piece of land. For instance, if you're on a river tile and you have the correct skill card (in this case the Engineer skill card) you can build a bridge across the river (you flip the tile over and the river becomes a bridge). Then you put your land control cube on the tile to mark that you own it.

The game ends for a specific player if they run out of troops. Troops can be lost in battles. The game ends altogether when one player acquires six pieces of land.

The catchphrase of the game is "Control the Field, Win the War." So it's all about maneuvering your troops around the battlefield (made up of terrain tiles), building structures to take control, and then defending them against attack.
With 100% hand-painted artwork by graphic novel illustrator Mark Woods-Hawkins and unique mechanics, Ground Assault® is a must have game in your collection!

Go Gorilla! is a balance game that promotes motor skills. Build a palm tree and place the monkey without the palm tree collapsing or being knocked over by the gorilla. There are 3 different game modes available: cooperative, against each other, or as a free game. 


Go Gorilla! ist ein Balance-Spiel welches die motorischen Fähigkeiten fördert. Baue eine Palme und platziere den Affen, ohne dass die Palme einstürzt oder vom Gorilla umgeworfen wird. Es sind 3 verschiedene Spielmodi verfügbar: gemeinsam, gegeneinander oder als freies Spiel.

This second game in the Shields & Swords Ancients series recreates ten battles spanning nearly three hundred years of Roman history. As was the case with the first game, With It Or On It (2019), The Grass Crown is a fresh, innovative taken on familiar material. The primary unit of maneuver is a "Wing" which itself consists of ten or so individual counters. Losses can be resolved by flipping the individual unit that was attacked, or by flipping any unit adjacent to it. Unrelenting pressure in the right places can prompt a Rout Check, causing the line to collapse. As the result of a single attack, multiple units can find themselves in your dead pile.

This simple but compelling theme sees many variations thanks to special rules that chart the evolution of Roman warfare, and contrasts them with the rigid Greek Phalanx, the sophisticated army of Hannibal, and the ferocity of the Gauls.

The ten battles are: Heraclea, Asculum, Trebbia, Zama, Pydna, Second Citra, Vercellae, Pharsalus, Thapsus, and Munda.

Micro Cosmos is a 1-4 player, card based, resource management game in which players try to terraform planets, create colonies and bring back survivors to their home worlds.

On each turn players move their spaceship (Ark), use their cards in one of 3 different ways in order to gain and convert resources and perform various actions on planets, moons and space stations.  Players try to gain victory points by terraforming planets, scouting for survivors, settling them on their home worlds and creating colonies on planets they visit.

Once a set number of planets is fully terraformed, the player with the most victory points is considered the winner.

The game includes a robust solo mode that uses a super simple Automa deck to perform the AI players actions. Various levels of difficulty create a challenge for any player.

Look and be amazed: the world's largest elephant circus is in town!

All the great elephants want to thrill the spectators with their tricks – but the tootophants are the real stars! You've never heard of tootophants? They are a very rare breed of elephants with golden trumpet noses that are much louder than their fellow elephants with trunks. Now the elephant circus is looking for a new circus director, because every animal would like to have the ring to itself – and there's a lot of confusion! Which one of you can collect the most elephants and tootophants and play the “trumpet” to his fellow players?

Build your own elephant circus in Der Trötofanten-Zirkus! To do this, at the end of the game you must have as many elephants and tootophants in front of you that are happy with you as circus director and follow you voluntarily. In the scoring, each animal lying open in front of you counts as +1 point.

At the beginning of each game round, each player draws a card from the edge of the ring and keeps it face down in his hand. In a clockwise direction, each player now takes a turn. Only when the player to your right has completed his turn, you show your card to your fellow players and take your action.

The game ends immediately when the last card has been drawn from the edge of the circus ring and applied. Now it is time for the scoring, and the points are counted. The player with the most points wins!

The game is set in a fantasy medieval realm where the battles take place in the air. Each player is a commander of a galleon fleet that floats in the air thanks to special crystals and balloons.

Every fleet has unique deck of cards. There are three location cards on the table. Each round players add their cards to these locations. At the end of a round, the scores are calculated and one of the player gets domination in the specific location. By covering special icons on the cards, players receive extra bonuses.

During battles players receive Victory Points. Whoever has the most VPs at the end of the game is the winner.

There is very clever variant for 1 player included.

Last One Standing is a snake-like game in which each player has two pawns to move around on the board using cards and tile abilities. Once you cannot move, you are out. The game ends when only one player is left.

On your turn, you will play a card from your hand, determining how many spaces to move. Before you play the card, you are allowed to play a tile from your hand.

Whenever you move a piece, you will flip the tile it just left, which may have an effect.

The players should lay out picture cards on their game board according to the chosen rule variant. At the beginning of the game, players are given a certain number of picture cards and lay them out on the given places on their board. During the game, players receive new picture cards and exchange more usable ones for the ones already on the board until the target pattern is met.

Shimiagaran are a forgotten breed of ancient scientists, wiped out from history by the cruel alchemists, out of jealousy, despite, and greed. The beliefs of mainstream alchemy could not bear the thought of another group beating them to the elixir of life. Hence, they got the kingdoms to support them, announced the elixir of life impossible, and denied the existence of Shimiagaran.

"Shimiagaran" is a play on the word "alchemists" in Farsi, something like "Alchemystery" if you will.

Shimiagaran is a competitive push your luck and resource management family game. In this game, players have to gather the necessary ingredients for concocting Light and Dark Potions. Ingredients are distributed in two separate sacks at the start of the game: the White Sack, and the Black Sack, which include a different number of Tarantulas. The White Sack has a drafting mechanism, and the Black Sack has a push your luck mechanism. After gathering the required ingredients and making the necessary potions, players can mix their potions to make legendary Elixirs.

Each player has 3 containers: a bottle to keep liquid ingredients in (white and red), a mortar to keep the plant ingredients in (green and pink), and a bag to keep mineral ingredients in (blue and yellow). Each container can hold a total of 5 cubes, and tarantulas can be kept in any container. At the beginning of the game, the white sack has many ingredients and few tarantulas, and the black has few ingredients and many tarantulas. As the game goes on and players take action, all the cubes, including tarantulas circulate between the two sacks.

On a player's turn they can perform one of the following actions:
Take cubes from one of the sacks or Make a potions or elixirs for Victory Points.

Players keep their cards beside their player board, and the amount of VP any player has is public. When one player surpasses the 30VP, the game ends after 2 more rounds.

Sucesos Argentinos Vol. 4 is a card game where Argentinian history knowledge is tested. Players must organize a chain of historical events chronologically ordered.

Each game can have from 2 to 4 players and lasts 15 to 20 minutes. It can be combined with other volumes to play up to 6 players.

This game box contains 75 unique double-sided cards depicting notable events in Argentina's history. On the front of each card are the name by which the historical event is known and an image, and on the back a description of the event and the year in which it occurred.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Sucesos Argentinos es un juego de cartas donde se pone a prueba el conocimiento de historia argentina de los jugadores organizando una cadena de sucesos en orden cronológico.

Cada partida puede tener de 2 a 4 jugadores y tiene una duración de 15 a 20 minutos. Puede combinarse con otros volúmenes para permitir hasta 6 jugadores.

La caja del juego contiene 75 cartas únicas de doble cara que representan sucesos notables de la historia argentina. En el frente de cada carta encontramos el nombre por el cual se conoce al hecho histórico y una imagen orientativa, y al dorso una descripción del suceso y el año en que ocurrió.

—description from the publisher (Spanish)

The world is ending and you and a group of like minded individuals have a bunker to live out the apocalypse.
However, there are people wanting to join you in your bunker, but there is limited space. You and your group must decide who is worthy to join.

You Must Be Bunkers is a 3 to 5 player party game where  the objective is to take turns to recruit the "best" candidates to join  your bunker to live out the apocalypse. The objective of the game is to get the people you deem worthy into the bunker before it reaches maximum capacity.

Each player gets dealt 3 cards from the each deck. This is your hand. One player is then chosen as the leader for the first round, this can be done by playing rock, paper, scissors or flipping a coin or just picking at random.

It is the leader's job to listen to all the other players and decide who gets to stay in the bunker. It is up to the remaining players to convince the leader to choose their person, by any means necessary. The person the leader chooses stays in the bunker and the player that convinced the leader to pick their person gets a ration.

After the leader has chosen a card and a ration has been given, the leader changes from player to player going around clockwise, you then repeat until you fill the bunker.

The game ends when you have 10 people (including the players) in the bunker. The player with the most rations is the winner!

The predators face off in a night scene where the most agile and fastest survives. Jaguars hunt alligators, curiyú, owls and toads, while spider web traps and the smell of skunks turn the game into chaos.

Includes 2 game modes: Hunting on the Island and Gathering Herds.

Hunting on the Island

With the agility of predators and knowledge of the species, protect the weakest animal on the island and take all the cards. You have to be very attentive, the fastest hunter wins!

Deal all cards among players, who will leave them in a face-down pile. At the same time, all players reveal their first card. The first player to cover the weakest animal on the food chain and shout its name, wins the round and take all cards. There are also some special actions cards that could change conditions for the round.

When all cards were played, the player with the most cards, wins.

Gathering Herds

To survive on the island, cunning and agility are essential. Group the animals by species and use all your speed to win the game.

Deal 5 to 7 cards to each player (according to the number of players). Leave the rest of the cards in a face-down deck in the middle.

The dealer signals the start, and each player, at the same time, can:

     Put down a pair of equal cards.
     Put down a card equal to a pair another player put down.
     Take cards from the middle deck to form pairs.


When a player is out of cards, the round finishes. Each player gets 1 point per card left in their hand.

At the end of the fifth round, the game ends and the lowest score wins.

The bees will show us their unprecedented wisdom and a cooperative social organization designed around the production of honey and above all, as a daily task that is incumbent on all the beings of this planet, to maintain the ecological balance through this activity so important as is pollination.

Build your games by gathering prayers and honey. Ask your opponents if they have that card you are looking for or fly to the garden to find it. The bee that forms the most groups of ores and honey wins the game.

It includes 2 game modes.


¡Volá!

Distribute to each player 7 cards for a 2 player game, or 5 cards for a 3 or 4 player game. The remaining cards are spread face down on the table, forming a garden shared by all players.

The objective of the game is to build sets of 3 cards of the same type (ores or honey) and number to play.

The first player takes a card from the garden and adds it to his hand. Then they must ask any player for a number and type of card, seeking to build a set of 4 with the ones he already owns.

Now, the player who was asked has two options:

     If he possesses one or more of that number and type, he must give it to him.
     If he does not have any cards of the type sought, he must answer: Fly!


The requesting player will then remove a card from the garden.

     If the card obtained from the garden matches the one you requested earlier, you must show it to the rest of the players and you can continue asking the others.
     If it does not match, it will be the turn of the player to his right.


When a player gathers 3 cards of the same type and number, he will place them face up to one side. The game ends with the first player who manages to play all their cards.

The player who has managed to form the most groups wins.


Color Miel

Immerse yourself in the universe of bees, where order and work are the fundamental tools to achieve the best and richest honey. Among flowers and beehives, you must be attentive to the numbers and colors to build your game. Use the speed and agility of the bees to lower all your cards and thus win the game.

Deal 14 cards to each player. The first player  takes a card from the deck and adds it to the ones he has.

They can now:

     If they have the Queen, you must lower her immediately and place her in the middle. Take another card from the pot.
     If the Queen is not lowered, you cannot go down beehive games or honey ladder, but you can go down a bouquet or flower ladder.
    If you can't do any of the above, you must pass.


The next player on the right follows, always taking a card from the pot and placing it next to their cards. On their turn, the player is entitled to perform any of the actions above or:

     Add a letter or more to a ladder, or complete a bouquet or beehive on the table.
     Draw a card from a game for another player that does not make it lose its status as a bouquet, hive or ladder, and use the drawn card to open a new game.


The game ends when one of the players closes by lowering all his cards. The other players must add up the value of the cards they have in their hand. Four games make up the game. The player with the fewest points will be the winner.

Deep river, mysterious because of the brown that covers it in the eyes of those of us who live above, hides thousands of species that coexist in that muddy and mighty ecosystem, where silver beings swim with the current looking for small prey and escaping from the larger ones.

Fish, predators and birds are confused with canoes, rods and the odd lost shoe in this exciting search game that will take your breath away. Accumulate as many letters as you can by responding to the search prompts. Become the best fisherman on the Paraná River, finding the species or lost objects that the cards ask you to win a race played at the speed of the current.

Place all the river cards on the table face up in the way you prefer. Place the stacked slogan cards face down.

Take a card from the deck of slogans. The player on the left is asked to call out a number from 1 to 6. The mentioned number will show what and how much the player has to catch. If the number you touch is the one with a picture, "Everyone should search at the same time." The first to find it wins.

If the player points to a drawing that does not correspond at all to the mission, they will lose a turn.

If the player completes the mission in less than 30 seconds, he keeps the slogan card. If it fails, it puts it at the bottom of the deck.

The winner will be the player who has won the most cards after four rounds.

After his disappointment with the new R$ 200 bill (Brazilian real), our daring Caramel Mutt decided to start a real revolution. He decided to consolidate Brazil once and for all as the King of Memes with a super game and bring fun to everyone on a level never seen before in humanity.

Have lots of laughs with our best Brazilian memes, expressions and slang that everyone loves. Choose the funniest and funniest answers and try to be crowned King or Queen of Memes. WHoever is judged the best, keeps the card. The player with the most cards at the end of the game, wins.

There are 600 sentences with 50,000 (one thousand) different combinations for you to laugh until your belly hurts.

A Story based on the fourteenth century in the midst of the Black Death that attacked Poor Europe, with touches of Fantasy from the Creator Himself.

When you are on your turn you roll the dice to advance through the board. You have the option of being able to play up to 2 cards but at the same time you can only draw one from the deck. The turns do not have a time limit so you have all the time to think about playing any card or simply advance and end your turn.

The game ends when someone reaches the end of the board or you are  the last player alive, since each player has a certain amount of life that varies depending on the character you choose at the beginning, if they kill you you lose.


Una Historia basada en el Siglo XIV en medio de la Peste Negra que atacaba la Pobre Europa , con toques de Fantasía del Propio Creador. Este incluye:Un juego de Mesa que mezcla un Tablero, Cartas , Dados con funciones diferentes, Selección de Personajes , Vida y muchísimo mas incluyendo un sistema basado en el puro Azar y el Riesgo por la Recompensa lo que hace que la "Cripta de Plagcrow" sea un Juego en donde el Jugador deberá pensar su siguiente movimiento y adaptarse a los Cambios Rotundos que puede dar el mismo juego independientemente de los demás jugadores. Tienes la Libertad de elegir entre una forma de jugar mas segura y defensiva, así como todo lo contrario y ser un Rival que solo busca desatar el Caos! aunque le pueda costar la Victoria. Con 7 tipos de Cartas además de ser más de 500 diferentes entre si y  extrañas formas de jugar lo hace un juego ideal si estas agobiado de los juegos convencionales en donde el factor sorpresa se apaga al jugar unas cuantas partidas ya sea con las mismas personas o cambiando de jugadores , La Cripta brinda que nunca 2 partidas se parezcan entre si así como esa seguridad de saber que nada asegura la Victoria ni la Derrota, Sera tu decisión de aguantar hasta el final o rendirte ante la situación.

In this game of hand management and bluffing by Richard Garfield, you are a movie agent representing actors who excel at particularly monstrous roles. Try to get them the part in the feature film! Or, failing that, at least a part in SOME film.

Each round you will assign a Co-star and a Star (cards with a number value and possibly a special ability) to audition for a role (a tile worth points). Everyone will reveal their co-stars and then have the opportunity to change what they are auditioning for and instead try for lesser films worth fewer points. Winning a part scores points - but there's a twist! If your star has a lower value than your co-star, you can't win unless everyone else stops competing for that film... but if everyone DOES back off, you score extra points!

The game ends after a fixed number of rounds, and the player with the most points wins!

Escape Room in a Box: Time Drifters is a story about two time travelers - Kira and Isabel - partners who have explored the farthest reaches of time, from ancient dynasties to the birth of the dinosaurs, and even the distant future. But disaster struck on their latest adventure, splitting their time machine in two and marooning them each in a different place and time!

In Escape Room in a Box: Time Drifters - Kira's Story, you take the role of Kira as she works to repair her half of the time machine and hopefully reconnect with Isabel before she is lost forever.

Just like all of the Escape Room in a Box games, the puzzles in Kira's Story are non-linear, meaning there is always something for everyone to do - just like a real life escape room.

Escape Room in a Box: Time Drifters - Kira's Story can be combined with Escape Room in a Box: Time Drifters - Isabel's Story to unlock a special bonus game, designed to be played remotely via video chat, that allows you to experience the final chapter in their story. Players from both groups will have to work together, share notes, collaborate on puzzles, and hopefully to reunite the two wayward time travelers.

What if you could explore books, browse the texts of novels, cross literary landscapes and their imaginations, surprise yourself with a few incredible sentences.

Nouvelles ContRées is a cooperative game that invites you on this dreamlike journey. You become novel explorers, navigating your best through the jungle of words, until you find, at the heart of the novel, the incredible hidden meaning of the book.

At the start of the game, players set up their Camp, represented by a bookmark, somewhere in the book. During the game, they will advance the Camp to a Lost City bookmark located further away.

One player plays as the pathfinder ("Pagefinder"): they read the first six lines of one page of any book in your library (as long as it has at least 60 pages). The other players have to guess which fully-illustrated bookmarks among 4 Dixit like bookmarks face up is the one chosen by the pathfinder. If the other players find the good bookmark, all the players succeed: they travel through the jungle of words by the same path (they advance pages in the book.).

At the same time, each player can try to accomplish an individual mission like "I guess the text contains 5 words with a X", "I guess it contains 3 words related to the nature", ...

To win, players will need to successfully explore this city and gain access to the Hidden Meaning of the book.
